kontext:
[LARRY'S BLOG: MY TRIP TO PARIS]
Hi friends! Welcome to my blog. You know I was in Paris last weekend. On the first day of my trip, I visited the Louvre Museum. I even took a photo of Mona Lisa’s painting. On Sunday, I visited the Eiffel Tower. Watching Paris from the top of the Eiffel Tower was very exciting for me. Wait for my new trips to new places. Until then, bye!
soru_metni: Larry tells us about - - - -.

secenekler.B: taking photos from the Eiffel Tower
secenekler.C: the history of the Louvre Museum

kontext:
[LARRY'S BLOG: MY TRIP TO PARIS]
Hi friends! Welcome to my blog. You know I was in Paris last weekend. On the first day of my trip, I visited the Louvre Museum. I even took a photo of Mona Lisa’s painting. On Sunday, I visited the Eiffel Tower. Watching Paris from the top of the Eiffel Tower was very exciting for me. Wait for my new trips to new places. Until then, bye!

kontext:
Researchers asked teenagers and adults about the types of transportation they preferred. Here are the results:

[GRAPH DATA: Number of people]
1. Bus: Adults (60), Teenagers (10)
2. Car: Adults (10), Teenagers (20)
3. Plane: Adults (20), Teenagers (10)
4. Train: Adults (10), Teenagers (60)
soru_metni: Which of the following is CORRECT according to the results?

secenekler.A: Travelling by bus is popular among teenagers.

kontext:
[BIOGRAPHY: NIKOLA TESLA]
A Famous Scientist
Nikola Tesla was born on July 10, 1856. He became interested in physics when he was just a small boy. He learned different languages, because he wanted to read about scientific achievements in different parts of the world. He invented many new things during his life.
soru_metni: In this paragraph, there is NO information about Tesla’s - - - -.

kontext:
The table below shows the results of a study on daily Internet activities of 100 teens in Japan.

[INTERNET ACTIVITIES - Number of teens]
- reading news: 5
- shopping online: 5
- checking emails: 10
- doing homework: 15
- watching movies: 20
- playing games: 45
soru_metni: According to the results, which of the following is CORRECT?

secenekler.A: Shopping online is very popular among teens in Japan.
secenekler.B: Most of the students use the Internet to do their homework.
secenekler.C: Nearly half of the students spend their time checking their emails and reading the news.
secenekler.D: Many of the teens spend time playing games and watching movies

Picture 4: Putting some pieces of chocolate on each mixture.

secenekler.A: Put some milk, sugar, flour and vanilla in a saucepan.
secenekler.B: Heat the mixture in the saucepan and stir it.
secenekler.C: Peel the fruits and chop them into small pieces.
secenekler.D: Pour the mixture into the bowls and put some pieces of chocolate on each mixture.

- No rules, just fun!
- All schools and students can join.

- Time: 5 - 7 p.m.

Suzanne: Oh, OK! Thank you.

kontext:
[FESTIVAL TEXT]
Every year thousands of people from all over the world come to Rome, Italy to attend the Pizza Vita Festival. This is one of the biggest food festivals in the world. In the festival, you can eat many different types of pizza, make your own pizza, enjoy folk music and buy local souvenirs. If you love pizza, don’t miss this festival.
soru_metni: Which of the following information is NOT in the text above?

kontext: Laura has some guests for dinner but she will arrive home late after the guests. So, she asks her husband Matt to prepare the dinner before the guests arrive.
soru_metni: According to the information above, which chore is Matt going to do before the guests arrive?

kontext:
Tina is having a birthday party tomorrow. She invites her friends, but four of them have excuses and they can’t go to the party.

[FRIENDS' EXCUSES]
- Andy: Thanks, but my cousins who are doctors are visiting us.
- Jessy: Thanks for your invitation, but I am going to the hospital to visit my grandfather who is ill.
- Terry: I’m sorry but I am ill. I have an appointment with my doctor.
- Amy: I’m afraid, I can’t come. I’m going to the hospital to conduct a survey for my project.
soru_metni: According to the responses above, who has an excuse about his/her own health?

kontext:
John did research on important inventors and their lives. Then, he filled in the table below.

[INVENTORS TABLE]
1. Richard Trevithick: invented train in 1804 (died in 1833)
2. Graham Bell: invented telephone in 1876 (died in 1922)
3. Guglielmo Marconi: invented radio in 1896 (died in 1937)
4. Philo Farnsworth: invented TV in 1927 (died in 1971)
5. Konrad Zuse: invented computer in 1938 (died in 1995)
soru_metni: According to John’s table, which of the following was NOT possible?

secenekler.A: Graham Bell went to different places by train.
secenekler.B: Guglielmo Marconi played games on his computer.
secenekler.C: Philo Farnsworth listened to music on the radio.
secenekler.D: Konrad Zuse talked to his friends on the phone.

kontext:
Jenny and Amelia are students in Istanbul. They want to go to a cooking course together.
- Jenny can attend the course on weekdays.
- Amelia is busy only on Fridays.
- Jenny has 500 TL and Amelia can’t pay more than 400 TL.

[COURSE OPTIONS]
A) Make Delicious: Monday and Wednesday / Price: 400 TL
B) Come and Cook: Tuesday and Wednesday / Price: 500 TL
C) Vegetable World: Saturday and Sunday / Price: 350 TL
D) Cook Well: Tuesday and Friday / Price: 300 TL
soru_metni: According to the information above, which of the following courses should Jenny and Amelia choose?

kontext:
Jessica invites her friends to her sister’s birthday party on Sunday evening. Below, you see her friends’ responses to Jessica’s invitation.

[RESPONSES]
- Betty: "Thanks, but my parents and I are going to a concert at 8 p.m. on Sunday."

- Linda: "Thank you for inviting me. I will come to the party with my cousins."
- Sally: "That would be really great. I like parties and I’ll be there with my family."
soru_metni: Who refuses the invitation because she has a plan with her family?

kontext:
Below, you see some parts of four different phone conversations.

[CONVERSATIONS]
I. Nora: Hello, this is Nora calling. May I speak to Jack?
   Jack: Hello, Nora. This is Jack. What’s up?
II. Anna: I have a message for Mr. Smith.
    Kate: Alright, I’m ready to take your message.
III. Jim: Could you tell him to call me back?
     Tom: Sorry, can you repeat it, please? I didn’t hear you well.
IV. Joe: Thanks, see you later.
    Max: OK, talk to you soon, take care.
soru_metni:
Below, you see some parts of four different phone conversations.

[CONVERSATIONS]
I. Nora: Hello, this is Nora calling. May I speak to Jack?
   Jack: Hello, Nora. This is Jack. What’s up?
II. Anna: I have a message for Mr. Smith.
    Kate: Alright, I’m ready to take your message.
III. Jim: Could you tell him to call me back?
     Tom: Sorry, can you repeat it, please? I didn’t hear you well.
IV. Joe: Thanks, see you later.
    Max: OK, talk to you soon, take care.

kontext:
[PHONE CONVERSATION]
Mr. Johnson: Hello! This is Mr. Johnson calling. May I speak to Mr. Potter, please?
Secretary: Hello, Mr. Johnson. - - - -. Would you like to leave a message for him?
Mr. Johnson: No, thank you. I’ll call again later.
Secretary: All right, sir. Have a nice day.
soru_metni: Which of the following does NOT complete the conversation above?

secenekler.A: I can’t put you through to him now, he has gone out
secenekler.B: I will get him now, hold on please
secenekler.C: He is not available at the moment
secenekler.D: He is talking to a customer at the moment

kontext:
[RULES FOR CREATING A PASSWORD]
I. Use three letters and three numbers in your password.
II. Don’t use your name in your password.

[USERS AND PASSWORDS]
- Mike's Password: 121234
- Nancy's Password: nc2626
- Robert's Password: tmr714
- Dan's Password: Dan362
soru_metni: Who created a password according to the rules above?

kontext:
[CONVERSATION ABOUT PIZZA]
Diana: Let’s eat pizza. There is a new pizza restaurant on Main Street.
Melissa: Are you sure? I don’t like their pizza.
Sarah: Why don’t we make it at home? It’s the best thing I can cook.
Maria: Yes, it is really easy. That’s what I bake on Saturdays. I will help you.
soru_metni: According to the conversation above, which two people state that they know how to make pizza?

kontext:
[CONVERSATION]
Jenny: Hi, Carla. Alice and I are going to watch a movie in my house tomorrow. Would you like to join us?
Carla: Oh, I have to study for my exam but I can’t say no to your invitation. Could you give me your address, please?
Jenny: Alice can pick you up. She knows the address.
Carla: That would be great.
soru_metni: According to the conversation above, which of the following is correct?

secenekler.A: Alice doesn’t know Jenny’s address but Carla knows it.
secenekler.B: Carla and Jenny will go to Alice’s house.
secenekler.C: Alice, Carla and Jenny will watch the movie together.
secenekler.D: Jenny doesn’t want to study for the exam with Carla.

kontext: Sandra and Mark are sharing their ideas about the Internet. Sandra believes that the Internet is useful but Mark doesn’t think so.
soru_metni: According to the information above, which of the following would Mark say?

secenekler.A: It is the easiest way of contacting our classmates, friends and relatives.
secenekler.B: Students spend too much time on social media when they are at school.
secenekler.C: Shopping and paying the bills online make my life easier.
secenekler.D: It helps us to find a lot of information in a short time.

kontext:
Jane is talking about her responsibility at home.

[VISUAL: Jane is cooking in the kitchen]
Jane: "I like being in the kitchen, so I - - - -."
soru_metni: According to the information above, which of the following completes Jane’s sentence?

secenekler.A: take the dog for a walk

kontext:
[POSTER: ANTALYA TREKKING TOUR]
Slogan: If you look for a great family adventure, come and join us!
Date: July 21
Time: 6 a.m. - 7 p.m.
Details: The tour includes breakfast, lunch and dinner.
soru_metni: According to the information above, which of the following is NOT correct?

secenekler.A: You can’t join the tour with your parents.
secenekler.B: You don’t have to bring food with you.
secenekler.C: It starts in the morning and finishes in the evening.
secenekler.D: The tour takes place in summer.

kontext:
Kübra wants to go to an English course to improve her English.
- She can attend the course after one o’clock in the afternoon.
- She can attend during the weekends.
- She has 2500 TL for the course.

[ENGLISH SCHOOL OPTIONS]
A) School 1: 8 - 10 a.m. / Saturday and Sunday / 2200 TL
B) School 2: 3 - 5 p.m. / Tuesday and Wednesday / 2500 TL
C) School 3: 5 - 7 p.m. / Monday and Sunday / 3000 TL
D) School 4: 2 - 4 p.m. / Saturday and Sunday / 2300 TL
soru_metni: According to the information above, which course should Kübra choose?

kontext:
[PHONE CONVERSATION]
Secretary: Hi. This is Dorothy. - - - -?
Max: Hello. I’d like to talk to Mr. Johnson, please.
Secretary: I’m sorry, but he is not available at the moment. - - - -?
Max: Could you tell him to call me back, please?
Secretary: Sure. - - - -?
Max: Max Carter. It’s 12345678.
soru_metni: Which of the following does NOT fill in any of the blanks in the conversation above?

secenekler.A: Could you tell me your name and phone number, please
secenekler.B: Would you like to leave a message

kontext: Anthony is going to do an extreme sport on Sunday. The main equipment for the sport is a parachute.
soru_metni: According to the information above, which of the following extreme sports is Anthony going to do?

kontext:
There are four students in a cooking class. They are asking their teacher some questions about how to make a cake.

[STUDENTS' QUESTIONS]
- "How long does it take to bake the cake?"
- "What are its main ingredients?"
- "Do we need two or three eggs?"
- "Can we add some chocolate into the mixture?"
soru_metni: Which of the following CANNOT be the teacher’s answer to any of the questions above?

secenekler.C: They are flour, milk, eggs and sugar.
secenekler.D: Yes, it makes the cake more delicious.

kontext:
A group of friends are talking about their school party.

[FRIENDS' OPINIONS]
- Adam: "I don’t have any plans for next Sunday. So, I’ll definitely be at the party."
- Claire: "To me, 4 p.m. is too early to start the party."
- Pete: "I think City Park is not a good place for the party."
- Tina: "The ticket is too expensive for me. I’m not going to come."
soru_metni: Who is talking about the location of the party?

kontext:
Mr. White asks his students to prepare an invitation card including information about the place, time and type of the event.

[STUDENTS' CARDS]
A) Dear Alex, Why don't you join us on Sunday afternoon? I can pick you up from home. (Ted)
B) Hi Kate, I have one more ticket for a pop concert. It is at Concert House. Shall we go together? (Matt)
C) Hello Melinda, I'm having a movie night at my house at 8 p.m. on Sunday. It'll be great if you join us. (Jill)
D) Hey Sam, We are organizing a birthday party. The party will be at 9 p.m. on Friday. Would you like to come? (Sue)
soru_metni: Which of the following cards includes all the information Mr. White asked for?

kontext:
Read the questions that Matthew asked Emily.

[MATTHEW'S QUESTIONS]
1. "In your opinion, what is the most important invention of the last century?"
2. "Why do you think so?"
3. "Do you know who invented it?"
soru_metni: Which of the following CANNOT be one of Emily's answers?

secenekler.A: We can do many things with it and it makes our lives much easier
secenekler.B: I have forgotten her name, but she was from the USA
secenekler.C: It’s difficult to tell, but I guess it’s the computer
secenekler.D: Scientists are searching for life forms on other planets

kontext:
Read the opinions of four people about their friends.

[OPINIONS]
- Alex: "Tim doesn’t forget to organize parties for my birthdays."
- Fred: "I don’t like spending time with Joe."
- Jill: "I don’t trust Betty, so I don’t share my secrets with her."
- Sally: "Ashley doesn’t support me when I need her."
soru_metni: According to the information above, who says something positive about his/her friend?

kontext:
Clara is going to buy some books for her friends.
- Robert loves reading about architecture.
- Lisa reads magazines about water sports.
- Mary usually buys books on health.
- Jack is interested in cooking.

[BOOK OPTIONS]
A) Best Rafting Places in the World
B) Modern Buildings
C) Secret History of the Telephone
D) Diseases from Past to the Future
soru_metni: According to the information above, which of the following books is Clara NOT going to buy?

secenekler.A: Best Rafting Places in the World
secenekler.D: Diseases from Past to the Future

kontext:
[CHART: SCHOOL RULES]
1. Keep your classroom tidy.
2. Be quiet while your teacher is talking.
3. Return the books to the library.
4. - - - -.
soru_metni: Which of the following does NOT fill in the blank above?

secenekler.A: Don’t talk to each other during the lessons
secenekler.B: Don’t be noisy in the school library
secenekler.D: Help your parents with the chores

kontext:
In an English lesson, the teacher asks the students to put the words into two groups. Group 1 is about cooking methods and Group 2 is about kitchen tools.

[Group 1: Cooking Methods]
- Bake
- Bowl (Error)
- Fry

[Group 2: Kitchen Tools]
- Boil (Error)
- Pan
- Teaspoon
soru_metni: According to the information above, which two words should change places to be in the correct group?

kontext:
Below, you see some parts of four different phone conversations.

[CONVERSATIONS]
1. Charles: Can I speak to Mr Brown, please?
   Secretary: Sure, he is waiting for your call.
2. Tony: This is Tony calling. Can I speak to Mr Jordan, please?
   Secretary: Just a minute, please. I’ll get him for you.
3. Ted: May I speak to Mr Logan, please?
   Secretary: He is in a meeting now, but he’ll call you back after the meeting.
4. Peter: Could you put me through to Mr Miller, please?
   Secretary: Yes, hold on a minute, please.
soru_metni: According to the conversations above, who is DEFINITELY NOT available at the moment?

kontext:
[BIOGRAPHY: Prof. Gazi YAŞARGİL]
Text 1: He was born in 1925 in Diyarbakır. He has two brothers and two sisters. He has three children: Leyla, Ceylan and Can.
Text 2: After his graduation from Ankara Atatürk High School, he studied medicine in Basel and Zurich.
Text 3: He developed new methods and special tools in medicine. He published lots of articles and he is the writer of many books. There is also a “Yaşargil” lab in Oxford.
soru_metni: Which of the following headings does NOT match with any of the three texts given above?

kontext:
Susan had some messages from her friends.

[MESSAGES]
- Carol: "I have two tickets for the concert at City Park. Why don’t we go together?"
- Jason: "Hey, Susan! We are going on a picnic on Saturday. Would you like to come with us?"
- Liz: "Thanks for the invitation. 8 p.m. is okay for me, too. See you there."
- Mandy: "Jane, Linda and I are having a movie night on Monday. It will be great if you join us."
soru_metni: According to the information above, who did NOT invite Susan to an event?

kontext:
Mike has written a new book about extreme sports. On the Internet, there are many comments about Mike’s book.

[COMMENTS]
- Joe: "Thanks to this book, I have learned a lot of interesting things about extreme sports."
- Kelly: "The first part of the book especially includes some very important information."
- Mary: "If you are interested in extreme sports, you should read this book."
- Nancy: "If you really want to learn about extreme sports, go and buy another book."
soru_metni: Who does NOT think Mike’s book is useful?

kontext:
Below, you see some information about different tourist destinations.

1. The Romans built the Colosseum in Italy. Thousands of people went there to watch events.
2. Babur Shah built the Taj Mahal in the city of Agra. You can enjoy its beautiful gardens when you visit it.
3. Adrasan is a small town in Antalya, Türkiye. You can go there by car.
4. You can go to Rize to try rafting on the River Fırtına.
soru_metni: Which of the following questions has the answer in all four texts above?

kontext:
[MAP: Cycling Tour August 2025]
- Start: Wednesday, 9 a.m. August 13
- Finish: Saturday, August 16
- Route: Part 1 (10 km), Part 2 (20 km), Part 3 (15 km), Part 4 (15 km). Total Distance = 60 km.
- Accommodation: Camping areas where you have to stay at night during the tour after you complete each part.
soru_metni: According to the map above, which of the following is false?

secenekler.A: You have to ride your bike for more than 50 km to finish the whole tour.
secenekler.B: You spend less than three nights at the camping areas during the tour.
secenekler.C: The tour takes less than a week to complete.
secenekler.D: The particular starting time of the tour is given on the map.
